Package lab_1.src.com.poo

Class SinglyLinkedList

java.lang.Object
lab_1.src.com.poo.SinglyLinkedList
public class SinglyLinkedList
extends java.lang.Object
In this class we define the methods for insertion, search and removal on the Linked List. The Linked List will store the variables of the tail, head and number of elements
Since:
25/10/2020
Version:
1.0
Author:
Bruno Teodoro, Diego Soares, David Arco

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    SinglyLinkedList()
    Constructor Method with head, tail and Number of Elements

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.Object get​(int position)
    Method that will call the getNode method based on the position of the node
    java.lang.Object getArray()
    This is used to create an Array of Elements based on the Linked List The purpose of this array is to have a useful display of the Linked List in order to complete the Test Units
    java.lang.Object getFirst()
    This method will return the first element of the Linked List
    SinglyLinkedListIterator getIterator()  
    java.lang.Object getLast()
    This method will return the last element of the Linked List
    SingleListNode getNode​(int position)
    This method will return the value of the node in a certain position If the position is false, it will throw an error
    void insert​(java.lang.Object element, int position)
    Method to insert one element in a specific position of the list The subsequent elements will be pushed
    void insertFirst​(java.lang.Object element)
    Method to insert one element in the first position of the Linked List If the List is empty it will create the Linked List If there is a element already in the first position, it will place the new element in the first position and push the rest of the elements
    void insertLast​(java.lang.Object element)
    Method to insert one element in the last position of the Linked List If the List is empty it will create the Link List
    boolean remove​(int position)
    This method is used to remove the one element of the Linked List in a specific position It will return True if we can remove the element from the list If the Linked List is empty it will throw an error
    boolean removeFirst()
    This method is used to remove the first element of the Linked List It will return True if we can remove the element from the list If the Linked List is empty it will throw an error
    boolean removeLast()
    This method is used to remove the last element of the Linked List It will return True if we can remove the element from the list If the Linked List is empty it will throw an error

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • getNode

      public SingleListNode getNode​(int position) throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
      This method will return the value of the node in a certain position If the position is false, it will throw an error
      Parameters:
      position - in the list
      Returns:
      node
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if Linked List is empty

    • insertFirst

      public void insertFirst​(java.lang.Object element)
      Method to insert one element in the first position of the Linked List If the List is empty it will create the Linked List If there is a element already in the first position, it will place the new element in the first position and push the rest of the elements
      Parameters:
      element - of the list

      Method to insert one element in a specific position of the list The subsequent elements will be pushed
      Parameters:

      position - in the list

    • getArray

      public java.lang.Object getArray()
      This is used to create an Array of Elements based on the Linked List The purpose of this array is to have a useful display of the Linked List in order to complete the Test Units
      Returns:
      Array

    • removeFirst

      public boolean removeFirst() throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
      This method is used to remove the first element of the Linked List It will return True if we can remove the element from the list If the Linked List is empty it will throw an error
      Returns:
      true
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if Linked List is empty

    • removeLast

      public boolean removeLast() throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
      This method is used to remove the last element of the Linked List It will return True if we can remove the element from the list If the Linked List is empty it will throw an error
      Returns:
      True
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if Linked List is empty

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(int position) throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
      This method is used to remove the one element of the Linked List in a specific position It will return True if we can remove the element from the list If the Linked List is empty it will throw an error
      Parameters:
      position - of the element in the list
      Returns:
      True
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if Linked List is empty
